normalised: Okay, here’s a Quora post on Waste Management:

unnormalised: **Question:** What are some practical ways individuals in India can improve waste management at home?
normalised: **Question:** What are some practical ways individuals in India can improve waste management at home?

unnormalised: Waste management in India, especially in bustling cities like Mumbai and Delhi, is a huge challenge. But we can all do our part, right? Small changes at home can actually make a big difference.
normalised: Waste management in India, especially in bustling cities like M U M B A I and D E L H I, is a huge challenge. But we can all do our part, right? Small changes at home can actually make a big difference.

unnormalised: First, start with segregation at source. Keep separate bins for dry (paper, plastic, metal) and wet (food waste, vegetable peels). This makes recycling so much easier for our safai karmacharis. My neighbour, Mrs. Sharma, swears by it!
normalised: First, start with segregation at source. Keep separate bins for dry (paper, plastic, metal) and wet (food waste, vegetable peels). This makes recycling so much easier for our safai karmacharis. My neighbour, Missus Sharma, swears by it!

unnormalised: Second, think about composting. Even a small balcony can accommodate a composter for your kitchen scraps. Imagine, turning banana peels into nutrient-rich soil for your plants! Remember that scene in "Lagaan" where they figured out irrigation? We can figure this out too!
normalised: Second, think about composting. Even a small balcony can accommodate a composter for your kitchen scraps. Imagine, turning banana peels into nutrient-rich soil for your plants! Remember that scene in "Lagaan" where they figured out irrigation? We can figure this out too!

unnormalised: Third, reduce plastic consumption. Carry your own cloth bags when you go grocery shopping at D-Mart. Say no to unnecessary plastic packaging.
normalised: Third, reduce plastic consumption. Carry your own cloth bags when you go grocery shopping at D-Mart. Say no to unnecessary plastic packaging.

unnormalised: Fourth, recycle properly. Know where your nearest recycling centers are. Many local NGOs, like the ones supported by Tata Trusts, also run collection drives.
normalised: Fourth, recycle properly. Know where your nearest recycling centers are. Many local N G O's, like the ones supported by Tata Trusts, also run collection drives.

unnormalised: Fifth, educate others! Talk to your family, friends, and neighbours about the importance of responsible waste management.
normalised: Fifth, educate others! Talk to your family, friends, and neighbours about the importance of responsible waste management.

unnormalised: Sixth, avoid burning waste. It is bad for the environment and your health.
normalised: Sixth, avoid burning waste. It is bad for the environment and your health.

unnormalised: Lastly, let's remember the 3 R's: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle. If everyone in India followed this simple rule, we could dramatically improve our waste problem. Let's make our cities cleaner and healthier! What are your tips? Let's discuss!
